question: Question_05
statement:
Solve for the matrix \emph{X} if

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
A + (BX)^T = C,\end{align*} where

$A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
2 & 1 & 0 \\ 3 & 5 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1
\end{array}\right], \quad
B = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0 & -5 & 1 \\ -3 & 7 & -1 \\ 1 & -1 & 0
\end{array}\right], \quad
C = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
-1 & 9 & 0 \\ 3 & 7 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 2
\end{array}\right].$
sols:
We first carry out operations to isolate \emph{X}

\begin{align*}
A + (BX)^T &= C\\
(BX)^T &= C - A\\
((BX)^T)^T &= (C-A)^T\\
BX &= (C-A)^T\\
B^{-1}BX &= B^{-1}(C-A)^T\\
X &= B^{-1}(C-A)^T\end{align*}

We now simply compute $(C-A)^T$ and $B^{-1}$ and multiply them together.

$(C-A)^T$:

\begin{align*}
\left(\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
-1 & 9 & 0 \\ 3 & 7 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 2
\end{array}\right] \quad
-\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
2 & 1 & 0 \\ 3 & 5 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1
\end{array}\right] \quad \right)^T  &= \left(\left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
-3 & 8 & 0 \\ 
0 & 2 & 0 \\ 
0 & 0 & 1\\ 
\end{array} \right] \right)^T \\
&= \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
-3 & 0 & 0 \\ 
8 & 2 & 0 \\ 
0 & 0 & 1\\ 
\end{array} \right] \end{align*}

We can invert \emph{B} by using an extended matrix and doing the
following:

\begin{align*}
\left[ \begin{array}{cccccc}
0 & -5 & 1 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 
-3 & 7 & -1 & 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 
1 & -1 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 
\end{array} \right] &\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccccc}
0 & -5 & 1 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 
0 & 4 & -1 & 0 & 1 & 3 \\ 
1 & -1 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 
\end{array} \right] \\
&\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccccc}
0 & -5 & 1 & 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 
0 & 1 & 0 & -1 & -1 & -3 \\ 
1 & -1 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 
\end{array} \right]\\
& \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccccc}
0 & 0 & 1 & -4 & -5 & -15 \\ 
0 & 1 & 0 & -1 & -1 & -3 \\ 
1 & 0 & 0 & -1 & -1 & -2 
\end{array} \right]\\
& \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccccc}
1 & 0 & 0 & -1 & -1 & -2 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & -1 & -1 & -3 \\ 
0 & 0 & 1 & -4 & -5 & -15  
\end{array} \right] \end{align*}

So

$B^{-1} = \left[ \begin{array}{ccc}
 -1 & -1 & -2 \\
 -1 & -1 & -3 \\ 
 -4 & -5 & -15  
\end{array} \right]$

You are then left with multiplying the two matrices out, which gives the
final result of:

$\left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
-5 & -2 & -2 \\ 
-5 & -2 & -3 \\ 
-28 & -10 & -15\\ 
\end{array} \right]$
